dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a lot of hard work ahead of you if you want to be a negotiator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm ready to do it. (a beat) And I'm going to be here more than two weeks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't go reading my lips, man. That's an intrusion. Save that shit for the sniper school. Comprende?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry... Habit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intervening) Let's move past this, gentlemen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're already past it, aren't we, Kevin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you say so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then you'll have to excuse me. I have other work to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roper...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About the transportation issue... You check with the impound sergeant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - RAINING MOVING with Roper and McCall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter the squadroom, wind through the cubicles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive at Roper's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper grabs an empty soda bottle from a neighboring desk. He takes the cap off a ball point pen and drops it into the empty bottle. He places the bottle on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall looks at the bottle quizzically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper grabs his jacket and walks off, leaving McCall to ponder the problem. McCall looks over at another cop who has been observing. The cop shrugs his shoulders. He hasn't got a clue. McCall sits down and thoughtfully peers into the bottle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You ever been in a hostage situation?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only at the very end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you feel after a shooting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (self-assured) Like it had to be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It rarely has to be done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've rarely shot anyone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: is a lifesaving unit, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try to remember that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, "Dead Eye", lesson one...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Extract that pen cap without touching or moving the bottle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the point of this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A little exercise in lateral thinking. The obvious solution isn't always the only solution... See you tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper and Baffert walking past the row of cars, including Solis' cadillac, searching for Roper's "new" transportation... Roper is holding the keys in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper is looking at the numbered parking spaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper bends over like an old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive at their destination. A parking space with a 1957 DODGE PICKUP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper looks at the pickup truck in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert unlocks the pickup and offers the keys to Roper who is crossing to the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes the keys from Baffert who moves around to the passengers side. He opens the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mind if we make a stop on the way? We busted Frank Antonucci on possession. He gave us a lead on that Polk Street jewelry heist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Phoney Frank"? Don't waste your time. He'd tell you his granny was in on the Kennedy assassination if he could dodge a collar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I still gotta do it. Wasting time is half my job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This SWAT guy might be a good idea. He may be able to take a little pressure off you. I worry about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You worried about me, too? The chief's worried about me. Solis is worried about me. Maybe you guys should start some kind of organization.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Speaking of which. I saw you talking to Ronnie this morning. Why can't you get it back together with her. You've gotta be out of your mind not to get with that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not me. It's her. She's going out with this baseball player -- Greg Barnett.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impressed) No shit! He's good!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck him. He swings at anything in the dirt. I could strike him out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't give up on her. You're getting to the age when you ought to be thinking about these things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yep, my rheumatism's been acting up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is it. Space 742.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then he didn't say 742. He must have said 724 or something, because this can't be right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh man! What am I, Red Foxx? I'm not riding in this shit. I can't roll in no shit like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the stereo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck the stereo. What's that smell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Just get in. We gotta go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The pickup in traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a four story twenties style walk-up. It's evening now. The pickup pulls to a stop out front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert pulls out a slip of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert gets out. Roper grabs his cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert turns back around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert goes into the building. Roper dials his cellular phone. Beep! Beep!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Apartment 306.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want me to go up with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nah, It probably won't turn up anything. I'm just gonna talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. I don't want to be late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want anything on the game?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was Warriors plus 6 this morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take half of your action.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A message on the display reads: RECHARGE BATTERY. Roper looks around. There's a payphone across the street. He gets out of the truck and crosses to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Third floor hallway. Nice, middle class place. Well kept up. Baffert walks over to room 306. Knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT Jazz is playing. MICHAEL KORDA sits motionless in a chair listening to the music. There's a KNOCK. Korda responds as if pulled from a trance. He rises and moves to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A slight hesitation from Korda. He glances around the apartment. For what reason, we don't know. Maybe to make sure there's nothing incriminating around. He opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda steps aside and lets Baffert enter. Korda closes the door. Baffert scans the place. Not bad. He listens to the music. A smile grows on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda smiles back. Another jazz aficionada.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda goes to the stereo, turns it down. Duke Ellington plays low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda drifts to the other side of the room. Takes a look out his front window...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It's Lieutenant Sam Baffert from the San Francisco Police Department.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened? Is there a problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: May I come in? I would just like to ask you a couple of questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Count Basie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Duke Ellington. "Things Ain't What They Used To Be", recorded July 30, 1945.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah... Yeah... Now I can hear it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you find an old recording like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Used record shop down on Turk Street. I was in there looking for some Robert Johnson. (searching for the name) Memories... Memory Lane or something...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got to stop in there... Mr. Korda, do you know Frank Antonucci?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean Frank who owns the bakery down the street?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, this is a different Frank. This is a man who deals in jewelry. Stolen jewelry usually. You wouldn't know anybody like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nobody there. Just the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says it as if the very idea disturbs him. He turns away from the window. Baffert feigns a coughing spell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda heads toward the kitchen area. Baffert uses this as an opportunity to drift around the room. Do a little snooping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert notices something in the trash can.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I certainly wouldn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could I please have a little water?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (the perfect host) Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The reason I'm asking you is because we arrested him with some stolen jewelry. It was traced to the robbery of a store down on Polk Street. He said he was fencing it for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Several glassine envelopes used for raw jewels. They have jeweler's markings on them indicating gem weight and grade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda, pouring the water, notices Baffert's discovery, but his face betrays nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda re-enters the room with the glass of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other a beat. Korda is still holding the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A real repressed tension here. Someone's about to get hurt. Baffert takes the glass of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a sip. Korda watches him like a cobra. Baffert puts the glass down on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda smiles. Baffert walks to the door. Opens it to leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert turns back around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert muses along with Korda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert moves off down the hall and Korda closes his door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calmly) There's obviously some mistake. I have a cousin who has had run-ins with the law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps for his own reasons he entangled me in this... situation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This cousin of yours... What's his name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forthrightly) Clarence Teal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your cough seems to be better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm on my way to the game. I appreciate your cooperation, Mr. Korda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lieutenant...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you believe that story about Robert Johnson...? That he made a deal with the devil at the crossroads?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Baffert gets into the elevator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert takes out his cell phone. Dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator hits the first floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator opens. Korda is standing there with a knife. Baffert has no time to react... The knife hand slashes forward... Stabbing the chest and slashing across the throat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (as the elevator descends) Hello, Judge Stone... This is Lieutenant Samuel Baffert. I'm at a suspect's residence. I'm requesting a telephonic search warrant in connection with an armed robbery at a jewelry store. There's visible evidence on the premises. Glassine envelopes with jeweler's markings were seen in the trash can...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I believe a full search of the premises will turn up some stolen property...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Korda calmly exits the building as Roper crosses the street, returning from the payphone. Neither of the men take any particular notices of each other. A WOMAN carrying her groceries enters the building. Roper gets to the truck. A SCREAM from inside the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baffert is laying in the open elevator, knife wounds to his neck and chest. Roper rushes over to him. It doesn't look good. The woman with the groceries is standing halfway up the first flight of stairs. Frozen. Roper pulls out his gun and rushes by her up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the woman) Get an ambulance!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper arrives at the top of the stairs. Korda's door is ajar. Duke Ellington can be heard faintly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT Roper nudges the door open, takes a step inside, gun ready... No one there. Suddenly, from the hallway, the click of a door. Roper races out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper sprints to the door at the end of the hall, KICKS it open. Gun aimed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 302 - NIGHT A five year old stares up at him. Scared stiff. Roper holds up a reassuring hand, and, as quickly as he arrived, he leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper burst out the front. Down the stairs to the sidewalk. Looks both ways down the street... Realizes in dismay that Korda is long gone. A SIREN approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - RAIN Angle outside window to Roper sitting in a chair by the window looking out to the rain. Solis is in the b.g. on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solis hangs up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper pauses at the door. Then pulls out two basketball tickets and lays them on the table in Solis' office. He exits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (on the phone) Yes sir. Every resource will be brought to bear. We will find this guy... Yeah, he's here now. I'll tell him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The chief says to tell you how sorry he is. He knew Sam Baffert was a good man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still looking out window) He said he was just going up to talk to him. He said... (beat; turning to Solis) I want to be put on this case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't do that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (emphatic) I want to be put on this case.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I can't assign you to this. You're much too close to it. You were much too close to Sam. The department will take care of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's running it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roper...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's running it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kimura and Glass will head the investigation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scott. Go home. Get some sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two detectives. A female named KIMURA and a tall guy named GLASS, try to make a getaway as they see Roper coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper intercepts them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper responds louder than necessary with a half turn toward Solis' hallway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, hey, hey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anything on Korda so far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Solis said to keep you clear of this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't give a damn what Solis said. (to the detectives) If you get a lead, I want to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - RAINING Roper's pickup drives by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thru the windshield. We see Roper as the windshield wipers flap back and forth. His face seems dazed and lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper knocks. Ronnie's cheerful voice can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper makes no effort to pull himself together. The door opens and Ronnie's face registers surprise. She's dressed casually in jeans, a nice shirt, but wears make-up and earrings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods, sympathetic, but doesn't leave the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie opens the door reluctantly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Just a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey yourself. Came by to see Troy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (like hell) A little late for that, Scottie. He's asleep. (smells his breath) Jack Daniels?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not drunk. Yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe you should be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I come in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper enters. Instantly we see he's at home here. He hangs his coat in the closet, puts his keys on the table, notices a photograph on the wall. Quite imposing. Very unique style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper gazes at it indifferently. He falls silent. Thoughts turned inward. Suddenly, TROY, (the dog), bounds in. He's ecstatic to see Roper. He puts his front paws on the couch and his head in Roper's lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper smiles briefly, pats the dog, taking comfort from his presence. His words are light. His tone isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie watches them, suddenly showing the sadness she's carefully buried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. A moment's silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not coming closer. She wants to, but she won't do it. She seems uneasy, glances towards the door. Roper rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches for her and she looks like she might give in to him, but at that moment there's a KNOCK ON THE DOOR. Ronnie pulls back, confused and guilty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her silence is the answer... A flash of pain from Roper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie watches as he searches for his keys in his pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs the keys as she opens the door. GREG stands outside waiting. He's a big, good looking guy with a smile on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Greg's smile fades as he sees Roper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper strides past Greg who remains in the doorway. Ronnie makes brief eye contact with Greg, but then moves past him to follow Roper. She calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper doesn't look back. He just goes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That a new picture?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About 4 months old. I'm working in a new style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Troy. How ya doin' boy? (to Ronnie) He heard my voice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How's the good dog. I miss you buddy. You miss me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He misses me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't stay long. I had to talk to someone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a bit surprised at his openness) You don't usually talk to anyone when you're hurting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was my fault. I was right downstairs. I should have gone up with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scott, You can't save everyone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've proved that, didn't I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, hell, forget it. This won't work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gentle) What do you want from me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something I guess I can't have anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't try to make me feel guilty. The whole time we were together, you went out of your way to prove you didn't need me. Now, suddenly, for one night, you need me again. I can't do it. I can't be more than your friend. Because I know what will happen. In a few weeks you'll be back on top, and you'll shut me out just as soon as you don't need me again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised, hurt) You think I didn't need you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you did, you never showed it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ronnie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You expecting someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This day just keeps getting better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (soft) They're on the table where you always leave them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, baby, I thought maybe you were...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just leaving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scottie... take care of yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A huge warehouse. Sun coming up over the East Bay, CLARENCE TEAL rides up on a HARLEY MOTORCYLE, carrying a large cup of coffee to go. He enters the warehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Car and Boat parts stacked in aisles ten feet high. Clarence shuffles through to his watchman's quarters which are connected to the end of the warehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Built on pilings with a panoramic view of the bay. Korda is waiting behind the door as Clarence enters. He seizes Clarence from behind and slams him against the wall and spins him around. Hot coffee soaks the front of Clarence's shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence is scared. He offers no defense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda tosses Clarence down onto the cot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears start to come to Clarence's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence sincerely feels bad. It's kind of touching in a twisted way. Korda moves over to the window to keep from striking Clarence again. He looks off across the bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence watches Korda warily. Things are beginning to add up in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda turns to Clarence with a penetrated stare that answers the question. Clarence is shaken by that. He starts to whimper again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're talking major fear here... Korda moves to him and we think he's going to bash him around again, but, surprisingly, he hugs Clarence's head against his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears of relief from Clarence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If you weren't family I'd kill you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You told Antonucci that shit came from me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So that we could get the best price. He's got respect for you. He's gonna try to lowball me, Mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You fucking idiot! Why do you think I use you?... To be a walking advertisement.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mike. I never heard of LaMarra flipping on anyone before. He said he had the cops paid off. Antonucci never flipped on anyone before. He had the cops paid off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not the fucking cop that showed up at my door!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened, Mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't want to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God damn it! I still needed to case that fucking store. It's too risky to show my face now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got a couple thousand bucks. You could leave town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave town? They're going to know me in fucking Des Moines now!... (a beat) They got over ten million in jewels in that place. That's freedom, man. I could go anywhere I want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you kill him, Mike?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, Mike. I'm really sorry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your fault you're stupid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper enters the squadroom. His mood is contained. He walks to a desk where Kimura and Glass are huddling. A couple desks over, McCall is reclining in Roper's chair, reading a book entitled, "Strategies and Counter Measures in Hostage Situations". On the desk in front of him is the bottle with the pen cap still in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Solis appears at their side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper looks at him icily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall, Kimura, Glass all watch this confrontation tensely. After a beat, Roper gives in. Indicates his compliance. Solis heads back to this office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves toward the desk. McCall gets up when he sees him coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall respectfully drops it. Roper looks down at the soda bottle.
direction.name: direction
