dialogue.raw_text: Why did he do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Because he knew the little girl had zero chance of survival and his chances would be a little better... We had a plan, but SWAT opened up too early. He got caught in the crossfire. (a sad beat) Let's move on... Notice this. Always use the eyes to keep the connection. It almost like hypnosis. That's the most important thing. Create a connection. You're always on their side...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beautiful day. Roper and McCall leaning against the rail at the walking ring. The horses are being paraded and saddled. Roper scrutinizes them with an expert eye. McCall seems totally disinterested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper ignores that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper points across the ring to a particular horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall listens indifferently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know why I like the track?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a compulsive gambler?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because there are a multitude of possibility's. Everything is there to see if you know what to look for. You have to read the conditions, just like in a hostage situation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See the four horse. Dropping in class. No works. Front wraps. Looks like he's broken down. But notice the woman in the sun hat. She's the owner. She wouldn't have come if her horse was broken down. He's live. We use him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See the favorite? Tail up. Washy. He doesn't want to run today. Cross him off... Now the Six looks good. On his toes. Coat shiny. This trainer/jockey combo does well. We can't leave him out. (turns to McCall) What do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have two words for you... Seek help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have three words for you... Ex-ac- ta.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper is buying tickets. McCall is with him, watching the other bettors, the odds board, all the monitors... Strange place. Roper finishes and turns away from the window. Hands McCall a ticket.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I bought you a four-six exacta box. You owe me twenty bucks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (puzzled) I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall pass by a gambler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sit down in a box right up front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper uses his binoculars to watch the horses warm up on the backstretch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper looks over at him. What's this about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper throws McCall a skeptical look.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Roper.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How you doin', Marv?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need the 4 and 6 to finish to first and second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (no enthusiasm) Fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm told that newspaper photographer is your former girlfriend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ronnie... Yeah, so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now she's going out with Greg Barnett?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what do you want?... An autograph.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know why she'd pick him over you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (straight-faced) I'm just practicing my lying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Still needs work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (downcast) You're right. I'll never be as good a liar as you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) And they're racing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The horses spring from the gate. (The track announcer's call plays through race)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper watches intently through the binoculars. McCall sits impassively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall looks across the track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper follows the horses into the turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall sits like a wax figure.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, we're in good shape. We're in good shape.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The 6 horse is last.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's okay. That's his style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To run last?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To run late!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The favorite's fading. I told you he wasn't going to run today... The four horse has got the lead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cynically) The 6 horse is still last.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll be running at the quarter pole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The horses head into the stretch. The FOUR is on the lead and the SIX is starting to unleash a big run. Passing horses with every stride.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) There he goes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: McCall sits forward slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper gets to his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They need to run first and second?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, first and second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The horses thunder down the stretch. The FOUR horse is in front and the SIX is coming on from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper is on his feet screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall jumps to this feet and joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall cheer together.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Russell! Come on, Russell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !... (to Roper) Who the fuck's Russell?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The jockey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The FOUR horse crosses the finish line in front. The SIX horse is flying... Needs to beat one horse to be second... He's running out of room... With one last surge he hits the wire and... It's too close to call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall, really excited, turns to Roper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We won!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (disheartened) We lost.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidently) We won.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much you wanna bet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to bet on whether you won your bet? This is getting sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As the photo finish light goes out and the numbers come on... 4-6-8. They won.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! High fives.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's eight hundred bucks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall collect their money. Four hundred a piece, not bad. McCall pockets his money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Roper's BEEPER goes off. He checks it, takes out a cellular phone and dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up and turns to McCall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long you been coming here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About six years. My partner took me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is it always like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Occasionally you lose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into the phone) Roper here. (he listens) I'm on my way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Marble facade. Tastefully reinforced windows and door. Choppers circle overhead. Both ends of the street are sealed off. Barricades are up. Spectators and news crews crowd behind those. Numerous police circulate. This is a major operation in full swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's across the street from the jewelry store. Second story. The walls are plastered with travel posters. A poster of Tahiti is the most prominent. Members of police and SWAT are standing over a blueprint of the jewelry store spread out on a table. Right behind them is a TV monitoring the front of the store. Solis is at another desk, on the phone. He's talking to the suspect.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We're working on that, Joe. These things aren't quite that simple.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall push through the barricades and come walking down the cordoned-off street. McCall takes a look at the jewelry store. Well fortified, foreboding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper looks over there, gives no reaction. They reach Solis' convertible Cadillac. It's parked out front of the travel agency building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This does not look good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See this. Solis has me driving the shit-mobile, and he picked this up straight out of impound for fourteen grand. Probably worth thirty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Police corruption. It's everywhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall enter. McCall joins the men who are studying the blueprint. Roper stands by Solis and listens, takes note of the poster of Tahiti. Looks inviting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solis pulls the phone away from his ear. Joe has obviously hung up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall returns from checking out the blueprints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper picks up the cellular phone. It dials automatically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This will take time to setup. I'll have to get authorizations. (he listens) Okay, you relax, and I'll --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do we got?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: minutes ago the silent alarm went off, then the fire alarm. A unit was a block away, and the suspect got trapped inside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any verification on numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've only seen and talked to one suspect. He calls himself "Joe". There's two jewelers, two salespeople, the manager, a security guard, and an elderly woman. This particular store is where they do a lot of jewelry making and repair. They have anywhere from 8 to 10 million in raw stones on any given day, so they sure as shit didn't just wander in. They knew what they were coming for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have you promised them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just that I'd talk to my superiors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any good points of entry?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The place is designed to be a vault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into the phone) My name's Roper. How are you people doing in there? (he listens) Solis is off the job now, Joe. I'm the guy authorized to give you whatever you want. (listens) That's right, but first I need to come down there to talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We don't see anything but the suspect on the other end of the phone. He's wearing a ski mask and gloves. Totally unrecognizable to the audience. We will find out soon that he is, in fact, Korda. He appears very cool and collected.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to come here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do. That way there's no misunderstandings. I need to make sure no one's hurt, then we can take care of business. A long pause... Then a bit sinister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper clicks off the phone. He already doesn't like the sound of this guy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Alright, Roper. You want to come... come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. I won't be armed. We gotta operate on trust here. We're going to wrap this up and have you guys out of here as soon as possible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper, bulletproof vest, hands in the air, walks across the eerily deserted street straight toward the jewelry store. It's quiet now. The choppers have been pulled back. Roper reaches the sidewalk right in front of the store. Korda cracks the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper stops in his tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper slowly lowers his hands.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (warningly) Stay there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to put my hands down, okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everybody watching through the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda takes a half step out the doorway. The gloved hand that is visible is not holding a weapon. The other half of his body is hidden inside the doorway. He wears jeans, a black shirt, and black Nike tennis shoes. He stares fiercely from behind the ski mask. There's no sign of fear in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda lets that sink in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda's eyes glare from behind the ski mask. He's an ominous figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda pulls a wadded-up handkerchief out of his pocket and tosses it to Roper. Roper unwraps the handkerchief.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you in charge, Roper?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want a car. Like a four wheel drive. I want it in perfect condition. I want a uniformed cop to drive it up right here. I want him to leave the engine running and walk to the end of the street. Then we'll come out. I don't want any remote control devices in it. I know all the tricks. If it's not in perfect condition, and I mean if its even low on wiper fluid, I'm going to kill somebody and we're gonna start again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want a plane waiting at the airport. I'll tell them where I want to go when I get there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that all?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For now that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll get it. But, Joe, I want you to do something for me. Let me take a look around inside. Make sure everybody's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. You just do shit for me right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe, I'm doing a lot for you. I think you could give me something to cement the deal... One hostage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll give you something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's a human ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper is as serious as we've ever seen him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda disappears back behind the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In fifteen minutes it'll be a bigger piece. I assume there are no "misunderstanding".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand you completely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Roper trudges back in. Things are more active now. Logistical officers are making flow charts. Photos of the hostages are being posted on a bulletin board. Roper approaches Solis, McCall and the SWAT CAPTAIN who are anxiously waiting for his report.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That draws a long silence. That's something Roper rarely says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper hands Solis the handkerchief with the ear in it. Solis eyes it with dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall calmly offers his opinion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solis nods. That'll be the plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SWAT Captain motions and turns to one of his UNDERLINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The underling hurries off to take care of it. Solis looks at Roper dejectedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper tries to buck him up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (flatly) We're going to have to take this guy out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't we wear him down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I believe there's at least one fatality in there already. The fire alarm was probably set off by gunfire. I believe he's working alone, both from his conversation and the fact that he wouldn't come out beyond the doorway. He was holding a gun on the hostages while he was talking to me. His demeanor is calm and controlled, that's what really scares me. The other bad news is that he also indicated a familiarity with our techniques. (a beat) So, do you want to go in or wait for him to come out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let him come out. Too many unknowns in there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When we drive up the car, make sure it's at an angle about three feet from the curb. (to SWAT Captain) Put our best man "highground", Twenty degree down angle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have Anderson prep it and notify us when he's on line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel this thing going sideways on us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is some good news. He's wearing a ski mask, so he's protecting his identity and hasn't determined to kill all the hostages... (big pause) Yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The jewel thief pulls off his ski mask to reveal he is Korda. His face is sweaty. Hair matted. ANGLE WIDENS to show five very scared hostages: A JEWELER, middle-aged, balding. The male MANAGER, good-looking, thirties, three piece suit. TWO SALESGIRLS, nicely dressed, late twenties. A FEMALE CUSTOMER, gray-haired Hillsborough matron. They are all seated against the wall. There are two fatalities lying on the floor. The guard and one of the jewelers. Korda points his gun at the manager and the other jeweler and motions to the dead bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men reluctantly get to their feet and commence the grim task. The two salesgirls watch Korda fearfully. The older female customer seems to be in a lesser state of reality. Her eyes are a bit far away. Korda moves over to the remaining display cases that haven't been looted. With the barrel of his gun, He SMASHES the glass, reaches in and picks out the jewelry. He dumps it in an open satchel already half-filled with packets of raw gemstones and gold chains. Suddenly, the older woman customer gets to her feet. She seems fairly out-of-it. Maybe in shock. She starts walking toward the front door frowning with dissatisfaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda rushes around the display case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs a handful of the woman's coiffed gray hair and drags her away from the door. She shrieks. The manager takes a step toward Korda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda pistol whips her across the forehead and drops her unconscious to the floor then turns the gun on the manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The manager glares at him. He's about Korda's size. He thinks about making a run at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long beat... The manager sits back down on the floor with the other hostages. Salesgirl 1 is giving aid to the old woman. Korda looks down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda goes back to the display cases to collect the rest of the gems.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Drag them behind the counter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not staying here another minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 (panicky) No, Mrs. Dotson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come here, hag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave her alone!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a brave one, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 (pleading) Sit down, Doug.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If she's not conscious when it's time to leave, I'll have to kill her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cops clear spectators out of the way as a green FORD EXPLORER RUMBLES through the barricade and heads down the deserted street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall at the window, attention fixed on the store. The Explorer crawls to a stop in front of the jewelry store. Parks at a slight angle. The uniformed police officer gets out, leaving the engine running, and walks off back to the barricade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper picks up the phone, waits. Everybody tensely watching the store.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. Time to give this fucker a call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sniper team watching the store from a third floor window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper holding the phone. It's still ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another sharpshooting team. Poised. Waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And still another sharpshooter team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone is still ringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, the front door of the jewelry store swings open. A spray of white vapor shoots out the doorway. Korda is discharging a fire extinguisher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thick cloud of white hangs over the sidewalk obscuring the front of the jewelry store. Roper puts down the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper grabs a pair of binoculars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This fucker's not answering.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's your answer. He's smart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's cutting down the visibility.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And doing a very good job of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Give us one clean shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into his radio) All positions, you have the green light.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through the haze, we catch glimpses of the hostages circled around the figure in the ski mask. They slowly shuffle toward the Explorer. McCall watches intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sniper watches through his scope. Finger poised on the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH THE SCOPE Low visibility through the haze. The figure in the ski mask wavers in and out of the crosshairs, shielded momentarily by the jeweler, then he flashes back into the crosshairs. The sniper tries to lock him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SAME The figure in the ski mask leans slightly and Roper catches a glimpse of the hostage right behind him. Roper recognizes him instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: McCall sees him now, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper drops the binoculars and grabs his police radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. A SHOT rings out. The figure in the ski mask goes down, hit by the bullet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More SHOTS ring out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's Korda.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They switched clothes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgently) Hold your fire! Hold your fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit! Where'd that shot come from? Hold your fire!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The white vapor cloud swirls. The hostages, spattered with blood, scream and scatter. The figure in the ski mask lies dead on the sidewalk. Korda, dressed in the manager's three piece suit, holding the satchel of jewels in one hand and his gun in the other FIRES back at the snipers. He grabs salesgirl 1 and drags her into the Explorer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper sees Korda move toward the car with one of the hostages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Roper turns into the room he notices a set of keys on Solis' desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Roper and McCall move toward the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Roper and McCall are gone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's got the girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damnit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grabbing the keys; to Solis) Are these yours?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, they are but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to McCall) Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Roper, what are you going to do? Don't take my...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Police come rushing onto the street. Guns drawn. The Explorer ROARS off down the block. Roper and McCall burst out of the command center building, leap into Solis' Cadillac and tear off after the van. McCall is behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Explorer comes barreling toward it. Spectators scatter. Two squad cars SCREECH up behind the barricades, trying to block Korda's escape. The Explorer PLOWS through the metal barricades. BASHES the squad cars out of the way. And screams off around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Explorer careens up an alley and bursts into the congested traffic of a side street. HONK-SCREECH! A Toyota swerves to miss it and broadsides a parked car. The Explorer fishtails off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The salesgirl is terrified. Korda checks the rear view mirror. No one on his tail... At first. Then the Cadillac comes speeding up behind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper and McCall have the Van in sight, about a block ahead. Roper picks up the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A voice comes back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Suspect heading west on Sutter now passing Jones. Can we get an intercept?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) R-32-David. We are proceeding south on Hyde. Will intercept.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Korda has one eye on the road and the other on the rear view mirror. The Cadillac is making up ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a squad car SCREECHES into the intersection and smokes to a stop. Korda jerks the wheel, pulls a SCREAMING right turn and heads up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac is only about a hundred feet behind the van... Brakes SQUEALING, it swerves around the corner in pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hits the top of the hill and goes airborne... SLAMS back down to the pavement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda floors it, and we get a frightening view out the windshield as they head straight downhill. The salesgirl is beyond petrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches the top of the hill. Going fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it rocks forward violently. Front bumper slamming against the pavement. McCall sees the van ahead. Hammers the accelerator. No fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda sees traffic ahead... Intersection jammed. He pulls a hard left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cuts straight across the corner... up on the sidewalk... shears a mailbox... a row of newspaper machines fly through the air... The van speeds off down a one-way street...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: arrives at the intersection a few seconds later... Intersection still jammed... People now standing on the corner gawking at the damage. The Caddy SCREECHES to a stop. McCall HONKS... The people scatter... The Cadillac drives through the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrong way down a one-way street. Cars coming right at us in every angle. Frantic HONKING. Salesgirl SHRIEKS. Tires SMOKING... No way to avoid collision... Except Korda pulls a left an instant before impact... The van speeds back up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down the same one way street... Comes up on the head-on traffic, now stopped, paralyzed with fear from the near collision with Korda...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac roars around the corner and heads up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda, checking the rear view mirror. The Caddy is a short distance behind. Attention still focused behind, Korda enters an intersection, running a red light... CROSS-TRAFFIC... Korda stiffens... Pulls on the wheel
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The van swerves... But not quick enough... GRINDING metal... SHATTERING glass... The van rolls over another car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LOOKING OUT THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD Korda and the salesgirl tossed about as the van does a dizzying roll...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and CRASHES back down to the street upside down. After a beat, Korda crawls from the wreckage carrying the satchel of jewels. The salesgirl does not emerge. He spots a cable car reaching the top of the hill and starting its long descend. He heads toward it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Korda comes toward them from the wreckage, some of the passengers view him uneasily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hits the top of the hill just in time for Rope and McCall to see Korda leap onto the moving cable car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: other passengers give Korda room. They can sense that he is not here merely for the ride. Korda looks out the back... Roper and McCall haven't lost track of him. The Cadillac is making up ground on the cable car. Korda moves to the back exit, pulls his gun and FIRES off a couple of shots at the Caddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bullet fractures the windshield. McCall swerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That makes up the minds of many of the passenger. They leap off the cable car. Korda takes aim on the Caddy again and FIRES! The brakeman charges down the aisle while Korda has his attention focused out the back and tries to shove him off the cable car... Almost works... but Korda is able to hang on by one hand... He swings around toward the Brakeman who turns involuntarily as he sees the barrel of the gun pointed at him... BANG! Korda shoots him in the back. The brakeman staggers down the aisle and slumps across the brake lever, releasing it more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The brakes are stressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now driverless, the cable car picks up speed... Broadsides a car... Pushing it into parked cars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda and the remaining passengers are rocked around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: towards us... Filling the FRAME...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shows the cable car leaving the wreckage in its wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It passes the smashed car. McCall looks at the speedometer as he paces the cable car. It's going at 45 mph.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck is going on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, but I've got to get on there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pull up alongside.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cable car barrels through... Plows into two cross-traffic cars... Knocks them aside... Keeps picking up speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weaves through the wreckage... Makes up ground on the cable car, trying to pull alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the moment, Korda is not shooting at the Caddy. His attention is now focused downhill as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cable car nails another vehicle sending it spinning off to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dodges the spinning car... Jumps up onto the sidewalk... Mows down parking meters... Jumps back onto the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda leans out the door, takes aim at the Caddy... Another jammed intersection up ahead...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees the cable car coming in his rear view mirror. He bails out...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: CAR OF MAN TRAPPED IN INTERSECTION

direction.raw_text: into the back of the car. Major impact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda and the passengers are thrown to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tumbles down the hill... Hits a car coming uphill and rolls into a parked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speeds up alongside the cable car. Roper climbs over the windshield, onto the hood and leaps onto the cable car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda sees him coming. FIRES. Roper dives out the other side of the cable car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper hanging off the side. He gets his gun out of his holster... Up ahead, a car pulls away from the curb... Roper swings around to get back into the relative safety of the cable car. As he does his gun is raked out of his hand by the car which avoids a collision by a millimeter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda aims as Roper re-enters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it CRASHES into the back of a car turning left. Everyone is thrown toward the front of the car. Korda's gun goes flying. Roper dives on top of him. They trade punches. McCall is in b.g. with the Caddy pacing the cable car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pedestrains bolt out of the way as the cable car streaks through...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper hammers Korda into unconsciousness. Outside McCall is honking and yelling like crazy. Roper looks over... McCall points ahead...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cable car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leaps to the brake lever. Pulls on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clamp tries to slow the descent. It whine and smokes... Then disintegrates before our eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper feels the lever go slack in his hands. The cable car is speeding toward the end of the line... No way to stop it... Roper turns and takes a running leap into the Caddy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lands in the passenger seat. Roper pounds his foot down on the accelerator. The Caddy lunges ahead of the cable car... McCall can't figure out what he's doing. Roper yanks the steering wheel hard right...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Caddy collides with the front of the cable car. Tires SCREAM. The steel wheels CLATTER. A cloud of burning rubber forms. The cable car grinds forward pushing the Cadillac... But it's working. The cable car is slowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd now sees the Caddy and cable car bearing down on them. General hysteria as they flee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda regains consciousness. Sees what's going on. He grabs the satchel and bails out of the cable car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Onto the hood of a passing taxi. The taxi slams on its brakes. Korda rolls off the hood, picks himself up and runs into an underground garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grinding to a halt just short of the end of the line. Roper grabs McCall's gun off the seat and leaps out of the Caddy to pursue Korda. People approach to ogle the two vehicles in astonishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper moves up an interior stairway, gun in "ready" position. He knows Korda is somewhere in the parking structure. He glides up the stairway to the third level. Checks back over the rail... No one around... Then a sound from inside the garage... Footsteps maybe. Roper carefully opens the door... Swings in with his gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lots of cars, but no one in sight. Roper moves quickly to the protection of a row of cars... He crouches down. Scans beneath the cars... No sign of Korda. Roper searches between two rows... Comes up beside a van... Thinks he hears something stirring inside. Whirls a gun toward the window. A dog lunges at the CAMERA... Snarling... baring teeth... Roper moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a BMW crawls through the parking structure. Roper steps into the FOREGROUND, right into its path, gun visible. The BMW rolls to a stop. Roper approaches with caution. Roper comes up beside the car and sees a very frightened 30 year old blonde. Roper takes a check out of the backseat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The woman rolls up the window and hits the gas. She drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper stands in the middle of the garage and takes a final scan... He has the discouraging feeling that Korda might have escaped. He heads toward the exit... Suddenly a SCREECH of tires... Roper whirls to see a sedan bearing down on him. He drives and FIRES! Bullets shatter the windshield. The car continues toward Roper. He has to roll out of the path of the car. The car swerves past Roper. Tries to make it down the ramp. Roper fires again, taking out the rear window and a rear tire. The car slides along the guard rail and continues down to the next level. Roper runs after it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - 2ND LEVEL As the car reaches the next level, Korda loses control and piles into a parked car. Korda crawls out of the car clutching his precious satchel of jewels. Dazed, he staggers away from the wreck. Roper moves to him with a face grim as death. He strips the satchel from Korda's hand and slams him against the open car door. Korda goes to his knees. Roper holds the barrel of his gun right up between Korda's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda stares back at Roper defiantly. He knows a cop won't kill him in cold blood... What he doesn't know is that Roper doesn't give a shit about those rules at this moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda stares past the barrel of the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that makes Roper even angrier... But he keeps it all inside. His expression is as cold as a San Francisco night. He yanks back hard on Korda's hair. Pushes the gun tighter against Korda's forehead. He's on the verge of executing this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a flash, Roper points the gun upward and fires off a SHOT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper jams the gun back under Korda's chin. A pull of the trigger would send a bullet straight up through Korda's skull. And now Korda is fully convinced. He squeezes his eyes closed. Face straining so hard, he looks like he's going to burst out of his skin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Give me one reason why I shouldn't kill you right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know Sam Baffert was a friend of mine. He had a wife... and he had a daughter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't give a shit about you or your fucking friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't kill me like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if you and me got into a struggle... and my gun went off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could I kill you then? (beat, beat) Could I kill you then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: moving across garage into position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long, long beat. Roper eases up and Korda smiles. Just when we feel the scene is over, Roper turns back quickly and kicks Korda in the stomach, then grabs Korda by the hair, pulls his head back and shoves the gun in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda is doubled up coughing, spitting up blood. Roper walks away as McCall moves in to put the cuffs on Korda.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Roper! Put it down!... Put it down man, we got him. (beat) Come on... Put it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We do this shit by the book, but you ain't gonna be smiling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper is sitting in a cubicle doing paperwork. A group of reporters and photographers move down the hallway adjoining the squadroom. One of them is Ronnie. Through the glass walls, she notices Roper sitting alone at the computer. She bids good-night to the reporters and comes into the squadroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper keeps tapping away at the computer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods knowingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie watches him for a moment. He stops typing, looks at her and smiles. She suddenly becomes self-conscious. Guess it was something she was thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns abruptly to leave. Roper finds himself rising from his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns back around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes a few steps toward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her innocently.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You weren't at the press conference.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wanted to get this out of the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got a bet on the game tonight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As a matter of fact, I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's already started.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was going to catch the last half on TV.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good-night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You having dinner with Mr. Baseball?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Greg is on a road trip. I was just going to make some pasta.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That kind with the garlic and the oil that I like so much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. The kind from Kraft, with the macaroni and the cheese.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been craving that stuff all week.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it's hard to get.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sequence omitted from original script.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie is making macaroni. Roper helps to prepare a dressing to go with the salad. He is mixing oil, vinegar, sugar and spices. He lets her have a taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a long pause as he looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie stirs the macaroni.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie puts the lid on the macaroni. There is a beat before she continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog yawns. They laugh. Roper moves closer to her. He kisses her and she responds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mmm, needs a little something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about? This is it. This is the stuff right here. (beat; he tastes) Well, maybe just a pinch more sugar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah that's it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you just stick your finger in and stir it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) Scottie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What would you say if I quit gambling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd say you'd be miserable... It's not the gambling. It's what the gambling got in the way of. The track is where you'd take your troubles instead of sharing them with me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scottie, remember the day you lost that hostage in union square. You came over that night and we made mad, crazy love. But I didn't even know what happened... 'til I heard it on the news the next morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's because I wanted to keep you away from that world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not that world. It's your world. It's part of who you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat) Veronica, it's not easy for me... I don't know if I can change overnight. But what I'm telling you is that I want to share everything with you, because I don't ever want to be without you again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lovemaking is over. Roper is gazing at the ceiling, thinking. Ronnie is cuddled around him. A comfortable moment...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What about Greg? What are you gonna tell him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay. We broke up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) When?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clarence Teal, Korda's cousin sits in front of the plexiglass wall. He's edgy, fidgety. Clarence doesn't like to make visits to jail. Korda, wearing prison clothes, is led in by a guard. Korda takes a seat at the other side of the plexiglass wall and picks up the receiver. Clarence picks up his receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda grips the phone, leans forward and stares through the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence is totally unnerved by this request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda glares at him murderously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Korda starts to draw the attention of the guard. He controls himself, lowers his voice. But the viciousness is still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't finish that thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence is getting very upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence holds back tears, because he knows he's going to have to do this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin', man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You gotta do something for me... this fucker, Roper, he's gotta girlfriend. She works at the newspaper. I want you to take care of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Michael, that's not my thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You gotta do this for me. I'm in here because of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Man, what's this about? Ya know, you were robbing a store. It wasn't personal. It was his job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exploding) Fuck you! You know what he did to me?!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He held a gun to my head and said he should kill me right then... He made me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do this for me Clarence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't make do it, Mike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to turn on me too? Who helped you when you were strung out? Who gave you money? Who bailed you out of jail?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't get away with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody knows who you are. Make it look like a robbery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A gray San Francisco evening. It starts to rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's cooking some kind of sauce. She has a taste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A subjective POV watching through the window as she moves around the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie pours some oil in a pan. The phone RINGS. She crosses the kitchen to answer it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper on his cell phone. Paco is on the seat beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper notices the rain, searches for the windshield wiper switch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, I'm going to stop at the corner for some wine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: How's Paco doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was going nuts at the park. He met this very attractive poodle. They made plans to meet again next weekend. Paco sits there panting. Roper pulls the pickup over in front of the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, dinner will be ready when you get here. She hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the window we watch her cross back to the stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie lifts the lid on the sauce. Stirs. It spatters on her blouse. She regards the stain with dismay. Puts the lid back on and leaves the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie unbuttons her blouse as she moves to the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes off the blouse, goes to the closet door... throws it open. She looks around. Something's not right. She takes a step into the closet and finds what she's looking for -- A laundry basket -- tucked away in the corner. She puts the soiled blouse in the hamper and takes a fresh one off a hanger. She buttons the clean blouse as she walks to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark. She turns on the light. She goes to the mirrored medicine cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind her the shower curtain is drawn, fluttering ever so slightly. She opens the medicine cabinet. Takes out some perfume. Dabs some on her neck. She puts back the bottle and closes the cabinet. We fully expect someone to be standing right behind her in the reflection... There's no one there. She turns off the light as she walks out of the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie walks back to the kitchen... Notices something on the floor further down the hallway... What is it? She moves closer... And now we get to the POV that tells us someone is in the house... Watching her through a cracked doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand opening a buck knife. Water drips from the fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie bends down. It's a wet spot. Like half a shoeprint. She reaches down to touch it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!! The oven timer. She hurries back to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns off the timer and pulls some chicken out of the oven. She puts it down on the counter and cross to the refrigerator. She opens the door and looks inside. The refrigerator door obscures half the FRAME... She digs around for something... We're sure that when she closes the door, he's going to be behind it... She takes out a head of lettuce and... Closes the door... Still no one there. She turns... Clarence is standing there. Dripping wet. Ronnie shrieks... The knife flashes forward... She grabs the lid from the sauce pan and CLANG... Fends off the blade. She bolts for the hallway. Clarence grabs her by the blouse... RIP! She pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She races down the hall. Clarence lunges into FRAME. She goes down... He goes down... the knife goes skidding down the hallway... Ronnie scrambles to get it... Clarence has her by the ankle... She claws for the knife... Just out of reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper's pickup pulls up in front. He gets out. Paco jumps out behind him. It's raining harder. They hurry up the walkway toward the house. Suddenly Roper realizes he forgot the wine. He goes back to the truck. Paco pads after him. Roper opens the driver's side door, reaches in and grabs the wine. He closes the door, starts away, but pauses to check himself in the window. Suddenly, a floodlight comes crashing through Ronnie's front bay windows. It SPARKS and FLASHES. Still plugged in, it bungees to a stop hallway down the front of the house. FLICKERING and FLASHING. Roper rushes toward the house... Crashes through the front door... Up the stairway... Paco bounds after him... Roper hits her front door running... Wham! He bounces off. He shoulders it again... The door doesn't give... He pulls out his gun... BAM! BAM! Shoots off the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT A QUICK SHOT of Clarence's hand grabbing the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper kicks open the door. Charges in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronnie is laying on the floor, gasping for air. Choke marks around her throat. Roper rushes to her side. Paco is on his heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods. Points out the back way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dog obediently stays with Ronnie. Roper dashes out the back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You okay?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Paco) Stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Raining more heavily now. Roper bursts out onto the back porch. Sees Clarence leaping off the last rung of the fire escape to the alley. Roper flies down the fire escape... Vaults the last flight and races after Clarence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence sprints down the block... Through the intersection... HONK! SCREECH! A car barely misses him. It does a one-eighty on the rain-slick pavement. Clarence disappears into the shadows. Roper arrives a beat later... Streaks through the intersection... Into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one is steep. Clarence huffs and puffs as he labors. He shoots into a doorway. Tries the door. Locked. He looks back. Roper is coming. Relentless. He rushes across the steep street. Almost slips on the reflective asphalt. Roper spots him crossing and picks up the pace. He can see that Clarence is faltering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clarence staggers into an alleyway...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NEAR THE TOP OF THE HILL

direction.raw_text: Narrow, dark and dripping with rain. Roper arrives at the mouth of the alley. Gun ready, he moves cautiously, eyes adjusting to the darkness. The PATTER of rain off the rooftops. His FOOTSTEPS. No other sound. He reaches the end of the alley... A brick wall. No way out. Or so it would seem. However, Clarence is nowhere in sight. Roper turns back. Brick walls tower on both sides, rising into darkness. Roper checks a steel door. Locked. He checks another one on the opposite side of the alley. Also locked. Where did Clarence go? He moves back toward the misting light of the street... Slowly... The FAINT RATTLE of a fire escape... And Clarence leaps down out of the shadow. Slashing with the knife. He catches Roper across the arm. Rips through his clothes right down to the skin. Roper's gun CLATTERS under a parked car and into the street. Clarence has first jump. He scrambles into the street, around the car and grabs the gun... Roper dives over the hood of the car and knocks Clarence down before he can aim. They roll into the middle of the street. Both have a death grip on the weapon. Clarence fights like a trapped animal. Thrashing desperately. Roper pins him on his back, but can't pry the gun out of his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Headlights radiate over the crest of the hill. Coming quickly. Roper sees this. He rolls out of the way, abandoning the battle for the gun. Clarence struggles to his knees. Turns the weapon on Roper... A speeding cab lunges over the top of the hill. Clarence turns, trapped in the searing headlights. Tires squeal. Brakes lock. Clarence is transfixed... WHAM! He's launched through the air like a ragdoll... His body lands limply 30 feet down the street. The CABBY gets out of his vehicle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper walks down the hill to the body. The cabby follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper ignores the cabby. He looks down at Clarence's body, contemplating something.

direction.raw_text: The cabby immediately clams up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roper stares at Clarence's body, steel-eyed.

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ. What was he doing?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was no way I could miss him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't my fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut the fuck up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get on your radio and get the police here.

dialogue.raw_text: If you try again to hurt me or anyone I know, I'm going to have you killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What in the world are you talking about, Mr. Roper?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's a picture of your cousin Clarence. That gentleman standing over him is the coroner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I used to have an apartment, a car, jewelry. I had a fucking eight thousand dollar watch. Now look what I have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're threatening me? You think I give a fuck? You think you can scare me off? (a laugh) Why don't you come in here and kick my ass? Get some of your guard friends in here to help. I'd like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smirking) He really shook you up, didn't he?... I've got ten years worth of appeals to figure out how to fuck with you. Who knows? Maybe some scumbag lawyer will get me out on a technicality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You came here to threaten me? That's a laugh. Maybe you should BEG me... Go ahead. Get down on your knees.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You motherfucker, I swear I'll kill you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: McCall is practicing his negotiating techniques in a mirror.

direction.raw_text: Not quite right. He adjusts his stance. This time puts a little hand movement into it.

direction.raw_text: He's still not satisfied.

dialogue.raw_text: #1 (rambling incoherently) I can't fight this technology. They have microprocessors made in totally sterile environments. I've seen those places. Everyone is dressed in white. It's like paper clothing, man. They're not even human.

dialogue.raw_text: #2 Dave, don't do this, bro. Pull me in. We'll do a few laps in the park and figure out some other way.

dialogue.raw_text: #1 I can't help this, man. Do you have any idea what those microchips look like? How small they are when they put them in your brain?

OFFICER #4 sure looks happy to see him. McCall takes a peek out onto the roof. He isn't happy about what he sees.

dialogue.raw_text: #4 Something about a microchip in his brain.

dialogue.raw_text: Dave, look at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me what's wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Particles, man. I feel them all the time. I feel them in my arms and legs man, that's how they punish me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can I help you with the particles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not just the particles man, it's the whole fucking machine, this is how they get assassins to operate. It's been this way since the cuban missile crisis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (blurting out) They have less power over you if you look into my eyes.

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?

direction.raw_text: Dave is suddenly lost in thought again. His expression turns to a frown:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then with sudden swiftness.

dialogue.raw_text: Let me show you something.

dialogue.raw_text: See this. I'm jamming them, Dave. I'm jamming their frequency so they can't control your mind anymore. Don't you feel that? You don't have to do what they say.

dialogue.raw_text: He's jamming them, Dave. Pull me back in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see, the particles are gone, they can't punish you anymore.

dialogue.raw_text: Tell my dad.

dialogue.raw_text: Is that where you're family lives?

dialogue.raw_text: McCall!

dialogue.raw_text: Come on four-seven... Come on... Come on... Come on...

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe... There's one thing you have to remember... You don't create the situations. You can only try to save people from them.

dialogue.raw_text: I thought I could do it. I was so damn sure of myself. But I didn't know what to say. The words wouldn't come. My mouth turned to mush. You make it look so easy, Roper. But it is not. It's not easy. (beat) It's a different job than looking through the rifle scope.

dialogue.raw_text: That it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How many have you lost?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I look at it as how many I've saved. That's the way you've got to look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what about the ones you don't save?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You live with it... and they haunt you. It doesn't leave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what if you can't live with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got to decide that for yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've lost three. One of them was my partner. I think about them every time I go into a situation. (a beat) There's a million people in this city with all kinds of twisted shit going on in their heads, and the bitch of this job is that we expect to go out every day and do the impossible -- to somehow control all this craziness... and we can't. (a beat) Nobody's faulting you for this, McCall. My advice is you let yourself off the hook.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... I don't know...

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, see what I'm sayin' is, I've got the -- HAWKINS Pick up a fucking phone for chrissake! You think I got time for this crap?

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, hey, I got shit on the outside. I got somebody cashing it in for me and --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gimme a fuckin' break.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Alright, alright, look, man, look, just leave me your card. I can get it to you by tomorrow night.

direction.raw_text: In a flash, Korda PLUNGES the pen DEEP into the guard's throat. The BLOOD jumps out of his throat, onto the window of the car as the guard, gagging in stunned silence, slumps to ground. He then falls backward between the two cars, drowning in his own blood.

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (continuing) You got something that belongs to me, and I want it back. (beat) Twelve-fifteen, Mare Island, North Entrance off Dixon. Building twenty- eight, by the dry docks. (beat) I so much as smell another cop, I'll be sending you parts of this bitch for a month.

direction.raw_text: He walks down the hallway.

direction.raw_text: Roper cautiously drives toward the gate -- the CHAIN securing the gate has been cut. Roper swings open the gate. As he drives past we see that the bed of the truck has been loosely covered with a TARP. Roper drives on, winding through the maze of roadways, huge buildings and equipment dwarfing the truc PRODUCTION NOTE: The idea is to take us into the facility to sell that it's abandoned, immense, eerie in it's scale -- a ghost town. We end up wherever we want for the next scene.

direction.raw_text: through the filthy windows, Roper far below, standing beside his pickup.

(PRODUCTION NOTE: Lathe will be cutting into a section of steel plate, demonstrating what will happen to Ronnie. Korda presses the STOP BUTTON, the lathe stopping. He releases his finger again, the lathe turning. He stops it. We can see that Korda is immensely proud of his 'creation', his focus more on sadistic payback than anything else at this point.

direction.raw_text: Leaning out the passenger's side SEES they are approaching the dry dock area. In the bed of the truck, along with the BOXES, SUITCASES and other objects, he sees several long 2x4's. Grabbing a BOARD he braces himself against the cab and then in one swift movement, stands, swinging to the driver's side, driving the 2x4 through the side window, through the steering wheel, past the dash and catching the tip of the ACCELERATOR PEDAL, pinning it to the floor. As Roper releases the board it WEDGES inside the door frame, locking the wheel and the accelerator, the engine SCREAMING wide open. Korda reacts in panic... Roper clings to the cab, looking over the top, the DRY DOCK looming towards them. He prepares to jump...
